title: Having issues Patching 7.2? Click Here!
body:
Hey all,

Have you been introduced to the Warwick ARH-WOOOOOOO meme yet?  Generally sick of reading ARH-WOOOOOOO on random threads? Well, too bad.  Cause this patch is going to bring them back in spades with the Warwick rework:

http://i.imgur.com/U78xvxE.png

If you're looking to give him a try so you can make the ADC's life even more miserable by CC'ing them from a few screens away, we don't want the patch to slow you down!  Complete the steps below if you are having any issues!  If they don't help, leave us a comment!

--------------------------------------------------------------

#***Updated Client (Beta Client)***

>*** Error: "League of Legends has encountered a problem. Please re-install League alpha client or try again."***

This issue rears its ugly head if something went wrong in either the updating or the installation process of the Client Update. The solution is to complete a full and clean reinstallation of League by following [**this guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/202539040-Reinstalling-League-of-Legends) to a T.

>***My IP Balance in the Store is incorrect***

There have been some issues with the client pulling correct IP balances. Some players have been able to resolve this by launching into the Legacy Client and making a single purchase to resolve this. If this does not work, hit us up in a [**support ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and we'll work together to resolve this.

--------------------------------------------------------------

#***Legacy Client***

>***Files Scanned reaches over 9000!!!!! Or, 15k, 20k, etc***

The patcher needs to scan already installed files to make sure that none of the files are corrupt.  If it finds one, it replaces it and rescans the files.  This is why it can sometimes get as high as 20k, even though there aren't 20k files in the installation.  

**The best thing to do is let it scan files!**  If you restart the client, it may cause it to scan even more files.   The patcher will eventually stop scanning files, and it will patch normally afterward.

>***Patcher stops/errors out at 33%, Patcher fails at 99%, or a general "Unspecified Error has occurred" message***

These are usually connection related errors. Either your computer is unable to maintain a stable connection, or a 3rd party security program is blocking League of Legends from properly patching. To get these issues resolved ASAP, make sure to go through our [Connection Issues Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)!

It sounds like you might have a bad config, which could happen if you are running in modifications or language packs.  Try resetting your Config to see if that does the trick:

Log into the game client.
Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
Go into a custom game and verify that settings have saved properly.  Leave game to sync settings.

At this point in the update, your network is communicating with our patching servers to download files.  Unless you're getting any errors, it's best to let it continue until finished.  Cancelling before completion can cause the patcher to rescan your files for corruption and redo the whole process.  Once finished, run through our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure your network is in top shape for any future updates.  I hope that helps!

I have been given five 20 minute low priority queue's because I tried to connect to a ranked game and as I was connecting it starting "repairing" my client. Is there any way that I can appeal my low priority queue's?

The only way to remove a [leaverbuster](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) penalty is by playing the required games without leaving.  The system will treat every leave equally regardless of why it happened because leaves causes others a negative experiences.
